full_summary:
# Notice of Request for Information
## Solicitation Number
WS4225437187

## Title
[Tender for] Capacity for Print Warehousing and Distribution Services

### Description
This notice is to invite bidders for providing warehousing and distribution services for print materials and promotional products belonging to Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada.

### Categories
* Procurement Category: Service (SRV)
* UN/SPSC Code: 78131800, 78131804
	+ Description (English): Specialized warehousing and storage; Document storage services
	+ Description (French): Stockage et entreposage spécialisés; Services d'archivage

### Regions
* Delivery Location: Canada

### Tender Requirements
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Request for Information: Yes
* Selection Criteria: The contract will be awarded based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

### Contracting Entity
* Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5, Canada
* Contact: MacConaill, Niall (SPAC/PSPC) (he/him)
	+ Email: [niall.macconaill@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:niall.macconaill@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

### Notice Details
* Notice Type: Request for Information
* Notice Date: October 13, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: October 23, 2023 at 14:00

Note: The deadline of 14:00 on the bid submission date is to ensure timely review. Contractors are required to review the solicitation documents carefully before participating.

Note: The text has been rephrased to be more concise and formal; however, it retains all the important details. The Request for Information is clearly stated, and the tender process is outlined.  Citations from the original text have been changed to first names only and titles have been simplified, such as that to *procurementMethod-methodeApprovisionnement-eng \\ Concurrentielle - Invitation ouverte à soumissionner \\ * to show we’re using the main part of the text not using the "+" citation which when I number the citations can confuse.
